articles.title: Logging In
articles.content:
How to Access MedFlow:

**Staff Portal Login:**
1. Navigate to your MedFlow URL
2. Enter your Email Address
3. Enter your Password
4. Click Sign In

**Patient Portal Login:**
1. Navigate to the Patient Portal URL
2. Enter your registered Email Address
3. Enter your Password
4. Click Sign In

**Social Login (OAuth):**
Click one of the social login buttons:
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Google
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Microsoft
‚Ä¢ Sign in with Facebook

Then authorize MedFlow to access your account.

**Forgot Password:**
1. Click 'Forgot Password' on login screen
2. Enter your email address
3. Check email for reset link (valid 1 hour)
4. Click link and create new password
5. Confirm new password
6. Log in with new credentials

**First-Time Login:**
You may be prompted to:
‚Ä¢ Change your temporary password
‚Ä¢ Set up your user profile
‚Ä¢ Upload profile picture (optional)
‚Ä¢ Set language preference
‚Ä¢ Review assigned roles

**Security Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Never share your password
‚Ä¢ Log out when leaving workstation
‚Ä¢ Use unique password for MedFlow
‚Ä¢ Report suspicious activity
‚Ä¢ Keep contact information current

articles.title: Creating Appointments
articles.summary:
Schedule patient appointments quickly and easily

Create appointments from Practice Management module with patient, provider, date, and time selection.
articles.content:
**Accessing Appointment Scheduling:**

1. Go to Practice Management module
2. Click '+ New Appointment' button
3. Or click on calendar to create at specific time

**Creating New Appointment:**

Step 1: Select Patient
‚Ä¢ Search by name or MRN
‚Ä¢ Select from dropdown
‚Ä¢ Or click '+ New Patient' to register

Step 2: Choose Provider
‚Ä¢ Select from available providers
‚Ä¢ System shows provider's availability
‚Ä¢ Can book with any provider if admin

Step 3: Set Date and Time
‚Ä¢ Select date from calendar
‚Ä¢ Choose time slot
‚Ä¢ System prevents double-booking
‚Ä¢ Shows conflicts if any exist

Step 4: Appointment Type
‚Ä¢ Office Visit
‚Ä¢ Telehealth
‚Ä¢ Follow-up
‚Ä¢ Annual Physical
‚Ä¢ Consultation
‚Ä¢ Procedure

Step 5: Duration
‚Ä¢ Default: 30 minutes
‚Ä¢ Adjust based on appointment type
‚Ä¢ Can set custom duration

Step 6: Additional Details
‚Ä¢ Reason for visit (optional)
‚Ä¢ Internal notes (optional)
‚Ä¢ Link to healthcare offering (optional)

**After Creating:**
‚Ä¢ Appointment appears on calendar
‚Ä¢ Patient receives confirmation (if portal enabled)
‚Ä¢ Provider notified
‚Ä¢ Status set to 'Scheduled'

**Calendar Views:**
‚Ä¢ Day View - See hourly schedule
‚Ä¢ Week View - Plan weekly schedule
‚Ä¢ Month View - Overview of month
‚Ä¢ List View - All appointments in list format

**Managing Appointments:**
‚Ä¢ Edit - Click appointment to modify
‚Ä¢ Cancel - Mark as cancelled with reason
‚Ä¢ Reschedule - Change date/time
‚Ä¢ Check-in - Mark patient arrived
‚Ä¢ Complete - Mark visit completed

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Verify patient contact information
‚Ä¢ Double-check provider availability
‚Ä¢ Add appointment reason for context
‚Ä¢ Set appropriate duration
‚Ä¢ Send confirmation to patient
‚Ä¢ Block time for lunch/meetings

articles.title: Waitlist Management
articles.summary:
NEW IN V1.1: Manage patient waitlist with auto-notifications

Access via Practice Management > Waitlist tab. Set priority levels and automatically notify patients when slots open.
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** Waitlist now fully integrated into Practice Management!

**Accessing Waitlist:**
1. Go to Practice Management module
2. Click the 'Waitlist' tab (next to List and Calendar)
3. View all patients with status tracking

**Adding Patient to Waitlist:**

**Method 1 - From Appointment Scheduling:**
1. Attempt to schedule appointment
2. If no slots available, click 'Add to Waitlist'
3. Fill in waitlist details
4. Click Save

**Method 2 - Directly from Waitlist Tab:**
1. Go to Practice Management > Waitlist
2. Click '+ Add to Waitlist' button
3. Complete the form
4. Click Save

**Required Fields:**
‚Ä¢ Patient (search and select)
‚Ä¢ Provider (preferred provider)
‚Ä¢ Appointment Type
‚Ä¢ Priority (High/Medium/Low)

**Optional Fields:**
‚Ä¢ Preferred Date Range
‚Ä¢ Preferred Time (Morning/Afternoon/Any)
‚Ä¢ Reason for visit
‚Ä¢ Internal notes

**Priority Levels:**
üî¥ HIGH - Urgent medical need, time-sensitive follow-up (notified first)
üü° MEDIUM - Standard follow-up, moderately important (notified second)
üü¢ LOW - Routine check-up, flexible timing (notified last)

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Active - Waiting for appointment slot
‚Ä¢ Notified - Patient notified of available slot
‚Ä¢ Scheduled - Appointment has been scheduled
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Patient no longer needs appointment
‚Ä¢ Expired - Patient didn't respond within timeframe

**Auto-Notification System:**
When matching slot becomes available:
1. System identifies matches (provider, type, preferences)
2. Sorts by priority (High > Medium > Low) and date
3. Notifies highest-priority patient via SMS, email, portal
4. Updates status to 'Notified'
5. Patient has 24 hours to confirm

**Confirming Appointments:**
When patient responds 'Yes':
1. Click 'Confirm Appointment' next to entry
2. System automatically creates appointment
3. Updates status to 'Scheduled'
4. Sends confirmation to patient
5. Removes from active waitlist

When patient responds 'No' or doesn't respond:
1. Click 'Move to Next'
2. Original entry marked 'Expired'
3. Next priority patient automatically notified

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Reserve High priority for medically urgent cases
‚Ä¢ Document patient preferences in notes
‚Ä¢ Review waitlist daily for expired entries
‚Ä¢ Call high-priority patients proactively
‚Ä¢ Clean up entries older than 30 days
‚Ä¢ Verify patient contact information is current

articles.title: Provider Scheduling
articles.summary:
Manage provider availability and working hours

Set up provider schedules, block time for meetings or procedures, and manage time-off requests.
articles.content:
**Managing Provider Schedules:**

**Accessing Provider Scheduling:**
1. Go to Administration > Providers
2. Select a provider
3. Click 'Manage Schedule' tab
4. Or go to Practice Management > Provider Schedules

**Setting Up Provider Availability:**

**Regular Working Hours:**
1. Click 'Set Schedule' button
2. For each day of week:
   ‚Ä¢ Toggle working day on/off
   ‚Ä¢ Set start time (e.g., 8:00 AM)
   ‚Ä¢ Set end time (e.g., 5:00 PM)
   ‚Ä¢ Add lunch break (optional)
   ‚Ä¢ Add multiple time blocks per day

**Example Schedule:**
Monday - Friday:
‚Ä¢ 8:00 AM - 12:00 PM (Morning)
‚Ä¢ 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM (Lunch - Blocked)
‚Ä¢ 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM (Afternoon)

Saturday:
‚Ä¢ 9:00 AM - 1:00 PM (Half day)

Sunday:
‚Ä¢ Closed

**Appointment Slot Configuration:**

**Default Slot Duration:**
‚Ä¢ 15 minutes - Quick follow-ups
‚Ä¢ 30 minutes - Standard office visits
‚Ä¢ 45 minutes - New patient visits
‚Ä¢ 60 minutes - Physicals, consultations

**Buffer Time:**
‚Ä¢ Between appointments (5-10 min)
‚Ä¢ Prevents back-to-back scheduling
‚Ä¢ Allows for charting/documentation
‚Ä¢ Accounts for running late

**Appointment Types by Duration:**
1. Click 'Appointment Types'
2. Set custom duration for each type:
   ‚Ä¢ Office Visit: 30 min
   ‚Ä¢ Annual Physical: 60 min
   ‚Ä¢ Follow-up: 15 min
   ‚Ä¢ Procedure: varies
   ‚Ä¢ Telehealth: 20 min

**Blocking Time:**

**One-Time Blocks:**
1. Go to provider's calendar
2. Click time slot to block
3. Select 'Block Time'
4. Choose reason:
   ‚Ä¢ Meeting/Conference
   ‚Ä¢ Procedure/Surgery
   ‚Ä¢ Administrative Time
   ‚Ä¢ Training
   ‚Ä¢ Personal
5. Set start and end time
6. Add notes (optional)
7. Click 'Save Block'

**Recurring Blocks:**
For regular commitments:
1. Click 'Create Recurring Block'
2. Set schedule:
   ‚Ä¢ Every Tuesday 2:00-3:00 PM
   ‚Ä¢ First Monday of month
   ‚Ä¢ Every other Wednesday
3. Set recurrence pattern:
   ‚Ä¢ Daily
   ‚Ä¢ Weekly (select days)
   ‚Ä¢ Monthly (select date or day)
   ‚Ä¢ Custom
4. Set end date or number of occurrences
5. Reason and notes
6. Save

**Common Recurring Blocks:**
‚Ä¢ Weekly staff meetings
‚Ä¢ Monthly quality review
‚Ä¢ Thursday afternoon procedures
‚Ä¢ Every other Friday administrative time

**Time Off Management:**

**Requesting Time Off:**
1. Go to My Schedule > Request Time Off
2. Select type:
   ‚Ä¢ Vacation
   ‚Ä¢ Sick Leave
   ‚Ä¢ Conference/CME
   ‚Ä¢ Personal Day
   ‚Ä¢ Holiday
3. Select date range
4. Add notes/justification
5. Submit request

**Approving Time Off (Admins):**
1. Go to Administration > Time Off Requests
2. Review pending requests
3. Check coverage for dates
4. Approve or deny with notes
5. System blocks calendar automatically
6. Notifies provider of decision

**When Time Off Approved:**
‚Ä¢ Calendar blocked for date range
‚Ä¢ Existing appointments flagged for rescheduling
‚Ä¢ New appointments prevented during period
‚Ä¢ Out-of-office message can be set
‚Ä¢ Coverage provider assigned (optional)

**Coverage Providers:**

**Assigning Coverage:**
When provider is out:
1. Set time off period
2. Click 'Assign Coverage'
3. Select covering provider(s)
4. Set rules:
   ‚Ä¢ Transfer all appointments
   ‚Ä¢ Only urgent/same-day
   ‚Ä¢ By appointment type
5. Notify patients of change (optional)
6. Existing appointments updated

**Multiple Locations:**

If provider works at multiple locations:
1. Go to Provider > Locations
2. Add each location
3. Set schedule per location:
   ‚Ä¢ Monday/Wednesday - Main Office
   ‚Ä¢ Tuesday/Thursday - Satellite Clinic
   ‚Ä¢ Friday - Hospital Rounds
4. Calendar shows location for each slot
5. Appointments automatically tagged with location

**Appointment Limits:**

**Daily Limits:**
Prevent overbooking:
1. Set max appointments per day
2. Set max new patients per day
3. Set max specific appointment types
4. System warns when approaching limit
5. Admin override available if needed

**Example Limits:**
‚Ä¢ Max 20 appointments/day
‚Ä¢ Max 4 new patients/day
‚Ä¢ Max 2 annual physicals/day
‚Ä¢ Max 5 telehealth visits/day

**Emergency/ASAP Slots:**

**Reserved Slots:**
1. Block specific slots daily for urgent visits
2. Example: 11:00 AM and 3:00 PM
3. Only bookable as 'Urgent' or 'Same-Day'
4. Auto-released if not used by cutoff time
5. Cutoff: 2 hours before slot time

**Override Scheduling:**

**Double Booking:**
For emergencies/urgent needs:
1. Attempt to book filled slot
2. System shows conflict warning
3. Select 'Override - Urgent'
4. Add justification
5. Provider notified of double-book
6. Appears as overlapping on calendar

**Outside Working Hours:**
1. Attempt to book blocked time
2. System warns 'Outside working hours'
3. Admin can override
4. Provider notified
5. Requires approval if provider settings require it

**Schedule Templates:**

**Creating Templates:**
1. Set up ideal weekly schedule
2. Include:
   ‚Ä¢ Working hours
   ‚Ä¢ Blocked time
   ‚Ä¢ Appointment types distribution
   ‚Ä¢ Buffer times
3. Save as template
4. Apply to future weeks with one click

**Template Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ Seasonal schedules (summer vs winter)
‚Ä¢ Rotating schedules
‚Ä¢ New provider onboarding
‚Ä¢ Standardizing across providers

**Schedule Reports:**

**Available Reports:**
‚Ä¢ Provider utilization (% of time booked)
‚Ä¢ No-show rate by provider
‚Ä¢ Average appointment duration
‚Ä¢ Peak appointment times
‚Ä¢ Cancellation patterns
‚Ä¢ Time off summary
‚Ä¢ Revenue per provider hour

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Set realistic appointment durations
‚Ä¢ Build in buffer time for documentation
‚Ä¢ Reserve slots for urgent/same-day
‚Ä¢ Review and update schedule quarterly
‚Ä¢ Communicate schedule changes in advance
‚Ä¢ Use templates for consistency
‚Ä¢ Monitor utilization to optimize
‚Ä¢ Block administrative time for charting
‚Ä¢ Coordinate time off with colleagues
‚Ä¢ Set automatic lunch blocks
‚Ä¢ Review no-shows and adjust overbooking
‚Ä¢ Use recurring blocks for standing commitments
‚Ä¢ Assign coverage for all absences
‚Ä¢ Keep contact info current for notifications

articles.title: Prescriptions & ePrescribe
articles.summary:
NEW IN V1.1: ePrescribe with edit mode and diagnosis linking

4-step workflow: Search medication, enter details, select pharmacy, review and submit with drug interaction checking.
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** Edit mode now prefills medication name with step-by-step workflow!

**Accessing ePrescribe:**

**From Patient Chart:**
1. Open patient's chart
2. Go to 'Medications' tab
3. Click '+ New Prescription' button
4. ePrescribe modal opens with 4-step workflow

**From Clinical Encounter:**
1. During patient visit/clinical note
2. Click 'Prescribe Medication' in toolbar
3. Patient context pre-loaded

**4-Step Workflow:**

**STEP 1: Search Medication**
1. Type medication name or NDC code
2. Select specific drug formulation:
   ‚Ä¢ Brand name or generic
   ‚Ä¢ Strength (10mg, 20mg, etc.)
   ‚Ä¢ Form (tablet, capsule, liquid)
3. Review drug information
4. Click 'Next'

**NEW:** In edit mode, medication name is prefilled - skip search!

**STEP 2: Prescription Details**
Enter:
‚Ä¢ Dosage (strength and quantity per dose)
‚Ä¢ Frequency (once daily, twice daily, every 6 hours)
‚Ä¢ Route (oral, topical, IV, IM)
‚Ä¢ Duration (7 days, 30 days, until finished)
‚Ä¢ Quantity (total number to dispense)
‚Ä¢ Refills (0, 1, 2, 3, PRN)
‚Ä¢ Instructions (patient-facing SIG directions)
‚Ä¢ Notes (internal clinical notes)

**Special Options:**
‚Ä¢ Generic Substitution toggle (DAW)
‚Ä¢ Prior Authorization checkbox
‚Ä¢ Controlled Substance auto-flagged

**STEP 3: Select Pharmacy**
1. Patient's preferred pharmacy pre-selected
2. Search by name, address, or zip code
3. Choose from recent pharmacies
4. Add new pharmacy if needed

**STEP 4: Review and Submit**
1. Review all information:
   ‚Ä¢ Patient demographics and allergies
   ‚Ä¢ Medication details and instructions
   ‚Ä¢ Pharmacy information
   ‚Ä¢ Drug interactions and warnings

2. **NEW:** Link to Diagnosis
   ‚Ä¢ Select primary diagnosis for prescription
   ‚Ä¢ Links to ICD-10 code for insurance
   ‚Ä¢ Improves claim approval rates

3. Apply digital signature
4. Click 'Submit Prescription'

**Drug Interaction Checking:**
üî¥ CRITICAL - Severe interaction, prescription blocked (override required)
üü° MODERATE - Potential interaction, warning displayed
üü¢ MINOR - Low-risk interaction, informational
‚ö†Ô∏è ALLERGY - Patient allergic, blocked (override with justification)
üë∂ AGE - Not recommended for age, warning
ü§∞ PREGNANCY - Contraindicated in pregnancy

**Editing Existing Prescriptions:**
1. Go to Patient Chart > Medications
2. Find prescription in active list
3. Click 'Edit' icon
4. **NEW:** Medication name prefilled (can't change drug)
5. Update dosage, frequency, quantity, instructions
6. Navigate between steps with context maintained
7. Click 'Update Prescription'

**Managing Prescriptions:**

**Renewing:**
1. Click 'Renew' next to prescription
2. Review and update if needed
3. Update refill count and quantity
4. Submit renewed prescription

**Discontinuing:**
1. Click 'Discontinue'
2. Select reason (completed, adverse reaction, no longer needed)
3. Add optional notes
4. Confirm discontinuation

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Pending - Submitted, not processed by pharmacy
‚Ä¢ Sent - Transmitted to pharmacy
‚Ä¢ Received - Pharmacy acknowledged
‚Ä¢ Filled - Pharmacy filled prescription
‚Ä¢ Picked Up - Patient picked up medication
‚Ä¢ Error - Transmission failed, resubmit
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Prescription cancelled

**Controlled Substances (EPCS):**
‚Ä¢ Valid DEA number required
‚Ä¢ Two-factor authentication for each CS prescription
‚Ä¢ State-specific rules apply
‚Ä¢ No refills for Schedule II

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Always review allergies before prescribing
‚Ä¢ Link prescriptions to diagnoses
‚Ä¢ Write clear, patient-friendly instructions
‚Ä¢ Never ignore drug interaction warnings
‚Ä¢ Verify pharmacy selection
‚Ä¢ Document alert overrides
‚Ä¢ Keep medication list current
‚Ä¢ Check prescription status

articles.title: Laboratory Orders
articles.summary:
NEW IN V1.1: Order labs with CPT multiselect and recurring orders

Select from 80+ tests organized by category. Support for one-time, recurring, and future scheduled orders.
articles.content:
**NEW IN V1.1:** CPT multiselect (80+ tests), recurring orders, and enhanced print functionality!

**Accessing Lab Orders:**

**From Patient Chart:**
1. Open patient's chart
2. Go to 'Laboratory' tab
3. Click '+ New Lab Order' button

**From Clinical Encounter:**
1. During patient visit/note documentation
2. Click 'Order Labs' in encounter toolbar
3. Patient context auto-populated

**Creating Lab Order - 6 Steps:**

**STEP 1: Basic Information**
‚Ä¢ Patient (pre-populated from context)
‚Ä¢ Ordering Provider (usually current user)
‚Ä¢ Order Date (defaults to today)
‚Ä¢ Priority (Routine, STAT, ASAP)
‚Ä¢ Clinical Indication (ICD-10 diagnosis - REQUIRED)

**STEP 2: Select Lab Tests (CPT Codes)**
**NEW:** Multi-select interface for multiple tests!

1. Click 'Select Tests' field
2. Dropdown shows 80+ common tests organized by category:

**Categories:**
ü©∏ Hematology - CBC (85025), CBC with Diff (85027), Platelet Count
üß¨ Chemistry - BMP (80048), CMP (80053), Glucose (82947)
üíâ Coagulation - PT/INR (85610), PTT (85730), D-Dimer
üß™ Lipids - Lipid Panel (80061), Cholesterol, Triglycerides
üî¨ Microbiology - Urinalysis (81001), Urine Culture (87086)
üíä Therapeutic - Drug levels (Digoxin, Theophylline)
ü©∫ Endocrine - TSH (84443), T4 (84439), A1C (83036)
üß´ Immunology - ANA (86038), RF (86431), CRP (86140)

3. Type to search by test name or CPT code
4. Click to select - tests appear as chips/tags
5. Click X on chip to remove test
6. Selected tests show with CPT codes

**Quick Panels:** Select panel to get multiple tests at once
‚Ä¢ Basic Metabolic Panel = 8 individual tests
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive Metabolic Panel = 14 tests
‚Ä¢ Lipid Panel = 4 tests

**STEP 3: Collection Details**
‚Ä¢ Collection Method (In-Clinic, At Laboratory, Home Collection)
‚Ä¢ **NEW:** Scheduled Date/Time (supports future dates!)
‚Ä¢ Fasting Required (toggle Yes/No)
‚Ä¢ Fasting Duration (8, 10, or 12 hours)
‚Ä¢ Specimen Type (Blood, Urine, Stool, Throat Swab, etc.)

**NEW: Recurring Orders**
For chronic condition monitoring:
1. Toggle 'Recurring Order' switch
2. Select frequency:
   ‚Ä¢ Daily
   ‚Ä¢ Weekly (specify day)
   ‚Ä¢ Bi-weekly
   ‚Ä¢ Monthly (specify day of month)
   ‚Ä¢ Quarterly
   ‚Ä¢ Custom interval
3. Set start date and end date (or # of occurrences)
4. System auto-generates future orders

**Use Cases for Recurring:**
‚Ä¢ Monthly INR for warfarin patients
‚Ä¢ Quarterly A1C for diabetic patients
‚Ä¢ Weekly drug levels for specific medications

**STEP 4: Laboratory Selection**
1. Preferred Lab (patient's preferred if on file)
2. Search by name, location, specialty
3. In-Network Labs (filter by patient insurance)
4. Verify lab performs ordered tests

**STEP 5: Results Distribution**
**NEW:** Multi-select recipients!
Select who receives results:
‚Ä¢ Ordering Provider (auto-selected)
‚Ä¢ Primary Care Physician
‚Ä¢ Specialist (from care team)
‚Ä¢ Patient Portal (auto-posts when ready)
‚Ä¢ Other Provider (search and add)

**STEP 6: Review and Submit**
1. Review all order details
2. Verify tests and CPT codes
3. Confirm laboratory and collection method
4. Check result recipients
5. Click 'Submit Order'

**After Submission:**
‚Ä¢ Order transmitted electronically to lab
‚Ä¢ Requisition form generated
‚Ä¢ Patient receives instructions (portal/email/SMS)
‚Ä¢ Order appears in pending labs list

**Enhanced Print Functionality:**

**Print Options:**
1. After creating order, click 'Print'
2. Choose format:
   ‚Ä¢ Full Requisition - Complete form with all details
   ‚Ä¢ Patient Instructions - Prep instructions only
   ‚Ä¢ Both - Requisition + instructions on separate pages
3. Preview before printing
4. Print directly or save as PDF

**Requisition Includes:**
‚Ä¢ Patient demographics and insurance
‚Ä¢ All ordered tests with CPT codes
‚Ä¢ ICD-10 diagnosis codes
‚Ä¢ Provider information and signature
‚Ä¢ Collection instructions
‚Ä¢ Laboratory barcode

**Managing Lab Orders:**

**Status Tracking:**
‚Ä¢ Pending - Order created, awaiting collection
‚Ä¢ Scheduled - Collection appointment scheduled
‚Ä¢ Collected - Specimen collected, sent to lab
‚Ä¢ In Progress - Lab processing tests
‚Ä¢ Partial Results - Some results available
‚Ä¢ Completed - All results received
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Order cancelled before collection

**Cancelling Orders:**
1. Go to Patient Chart > Laboratory
2. Find pending order
3. Click 'Cancel Order'
4. Select reason and add notes
5. Confirm cancellation
Note: Can only cancel before specimen collection

**Viewing Results:**
1. System notification for new results
2. Go to Patient Chart > Laboratory
3. Click completed order
4. Review results panel:
   ‚Ä¢ Test name and value
   ‚Ä¢ Reference range
   ‚Ä¢ Abnormal flag (H, L, Critical)
   ‚Ä¢ Result date/time
   ‚Ä¢ Performing lab

**Abnormal Results:**
üî¥ Critical (H/L) - Red text, immediate attention
üü° Abnormal - Yellow background, outside range
‚ö™ Normal - Standard display, within range

**Critical Values:** Trigger immediate alerts via SMS, email, system notification. Must acknowledge and document follow-up.

**Documenting Review:**
1. Click 'Sign Results'
2. Add interpretation notes
3. Document follow-up plan:
   ‚Ä¢ No action needed
   ‚Ä¢ Retest scheduled
   ‚Ä¢ Treatment adjustment
   ‚Ä¢ Specialist referral
   ‚Ä¢ Patient notified
4. Apply electronic signature

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Always include diagnosis for insurance approval
‚Ä¢ Use panels when appropriate to reduce costs
‚Ä¢ Check for duplicates before ordering
‚Ä¢ Set correct priority (reserve STAT for emergencies)
‚Ä¢ Verify fasting requirements
‚Ä¢ Use recurring orders for chronic monitoring
‚Ä¢ Sign all results promptly
‚Ä¢ Document action on abnormal results
‚Ä¢ Notify patients of results timely

articles.title: Video Consultations
articles.summary:
Conduct virtual video consultations with patients

Start video calls from appointments or patient chart. Built-in screen sharing and chat features.
articles.content:
**Starting a Telehealth Session:**

From Appointment:
1. Go to Practice Management > Calendar
2. Find telehealth appointment
3. Click 'Start Video Call' button
4. System opens video interface
5. Patient joins from portal

From Patient Chart:
1. Open patient's chart
2. Click 'Start Telehealth' button
3. Patient receives instant notification
4. Both join video session

**Before Starting:**
‚Ä¢ Test camera and microphone
‚Ä¢ Ensure stable internet connection
‚Ä¢ Close other applications
‚Ä¢ Use headphones for better audio
‚Ä¢ Have patient chart open

**Video Interface Features:**
‚Ä¢ HD video and audio
‚Ä¢ Screen sharing capability
‚Ä¢ Text chat window
‚Ä¢ Mute/unmute controls
‚Ä¢ Camera on/off toggle
‚Ä¢ Recording option (with consent)
‚Ä¢ Waiting room for patients
‚Ä¢ Background blur option

**During Consultation:**
‚Ä¢ Verify patient identity
‚Ä¢ Confirm consent for telehealth
‚Ä¢ Conduct exam as normal
‚Ä¢ Use screen share to review results
‚Ä¢ Document visit in real-time
‚Ä¢ Can prescribe medications
‚Ä¢ Can order lab tests

**Documentation:**
‚Ä¢ Note type automatically set to 'Telehealth'
‚Ä¢ SOAP notes supported
‚Ä¢ Screen captures can be saved
‚Ä¢ Recording stored securely (if enabled)
‚Ä¢ Visit duration tracked
‚Ä¢ Billing codes auto-populated

**Technical Support:**
‚Ä¢ Test Call feature to verify setup
‚Ä¢ Browser compatibility check
‚Ä¢ Bandwidth requirements: 5 Mbps minimum
‚Ä¢ Supported browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
‚Ä¢ Mobile apps available for iOS and Android

**Troubleshooting:**
‚Ä¢ No video - Check camera permissions
‚Ä¢ No audio - Check microphone permissions
‚Ä¢ Poor quality - Check internet speed
‚Ä¢ Can't connect - Refresh browser
‚Ä¢ Patient issues - Send test link

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Schedule telehealth like regular appointments
‚Ä¢ Send reminder with tech requirements
‚Ä¢ Start call 5 minutes early to test
‚Ä¢ Maintain professional appearance
‚Ä¢ Good lighting and quiet environment
‚Ä¢ Keep eye contact with camera
‚Ä¢ Document any technical issues
‚Ä¢ Follow up if call quality was poor

articles.title: Claims Management
articles.summary:
Create and submit insurance claims electronically

Submit claims to insurance payers with real-time eligibility verification and status tracking.
articles.content:
**Creating Insurance Claims:**

**Accessing Claims:**
1. Go to Revenue Cycle Management module
2. Click 'Claims' tab
3. Click '+ New Claim' button

**Automatic Claim Generation:**
Claims auto-generate from:
‚Ä¢ Completed appointments
‚Ä¢ Signed clinical encounter notes
‚Ä¢ Procedures performed
‚Ä¢ Services rendered

System automatically:
‚Ä¢ Links diagnosis codes (ICD-10)
‚Ä¢ Links procedure codes (CPT)
‚Ä¢ Pulls patient insurance information
‚Ä¢ Calculates charges
‚Ä¢ Validates claim data

**Manual Claim Creation:**

Step 1: Patient Selection
‚Ä¢ Search by name or MRN
‚Ä¢ System displays active insurance
‚Ä¢ Verify coverage is active

Step 2: Service Information
‚Ä¢ Date of Service (DOS)
‚Ä¢ Place of Service (POS code)
‚Ä¢ Type of Service
‚Ä¢ Rendering Provider
‚Ä¢ Referring Provider (if applicable)

Step 3: Diagnosis Codes (ICD-10)
‚Ä¢ Primary diagnosis (required)
‚Ä¢ Secondary diagnoses (up to 11)
‚Ä¢ Diagnosis pointer for each procedure
‚Ä¢ Search by code or description

Step 4: Procedure Codes (CPT/HCPCS)
For each service:
‚Ä¢ CPT/HCPCS code
‚Ä¢ Modifiers (if applicable)
‚Ä¢ Units/quantity
‚Ä¢ Charge amount
‚Ä¢ Diagnosis pointer (links to ICD-10)

**Common CPT Codes:**
‚Ä¢ 99213 - Established patient office visit (15 min)
‚Ä¢ 99214 - Established patient office visit (25 min)
‚Ä¢ 99203 - New patient office visit (30 min)
‚Ä¢ 99204 - New patient office visit (45 min)
‚Ä¢ 99396 - Preventive visit, established

Step 5: Review and Validate
System checks:
‚Ä¢ Coverage verification
‚Ä¢ Medical necessity (diagnosis supports procedure)
‚Ä¢ Duplicate claim detection
‚Ä¢ Missing required fields
‚Ä¢ Coding errors

**Real-Time Eligibility Verification:**
1. Click 'Verify Coverage' button
2. System contacts payer in real-time
3. Returns:
   ‚Ä¢ Active/Inactive status
   ‚Ä¢ Deductible met/remaining
   ‚Ä¢ Co-pay amount
   ‚Ä¢ Co-insurance percentage
   ‚Ä¢ Out-of-pocket max
   ‚Ä¢ Prior authorization requirements

**Submitting Claims:**

**Electronic Submission (837):**
1. Review claim details
2. Click 'Submit Electronically'
3. Claim sent via clearinghouse
4. Receive acknowledgement (999/997)
5. Status updates automatically

**Paper Submission (CMS-1500):**
1. Click 'Print CMS-1500'
2. Review form for accuracy
3. Print and sign
4. Mail to payer address
5. Manually track status

**Claim Status Tracking:**

‚Ä¢ Draft - Claim created, not submitted
‚Ä¢ Ready to Submit - Validated, awaiting submission
‚Ä¢ Submitted - Sent to payer
‚Ä¢ Acknowledged - Payer received claim
‚Ä¢ In Process - Payer processing claim
‚Ä¢ Accepted - Claim approved for payment
‚Ä¢ Paid - Payment received (EOB posted)
‚Ä¢ Denied - Claim rejected by payer
‚Ä¢ Appealed - Denial appealed
‚Ä¢ Closed - Claim finalized

**Claim Denials:**

Common Denial Reasons:
‚Ä¢ Coverage terminated
‚Ä¢ Services not covered
‚Ä¢ Missing/invalid diagnosis code
‚Ä¢ Medical necessity not met
‚Ä¢ Timely filing limit exceeded
‚Ä¢ Duplicate claim
‚Ä¢ Incorrect patient information

**Handling Denials:**
1. Click denied claim
2. Review denial reason code
3. Check EOB/remittance advice
4. Determine action:
   ‚Ä¢ Correct and resubmit
   ‚Ä¢ Appeal with documentation
   ‚Ä¢ Write off as adjustment
   ‚Ä¢ Bill patient (if applicable)

**Corrected Claims:**
1. Open denied claim
2. Click 'Create Corrected Claim'
3. Update incorrect information
4. Mark as 'Corrected Claim' (Claim Frequency 7)
5. Reference original claim number (ICN)
6. Resubmit

**Appeals Process:**
1. Click 'Appeal Denial'
2. Select appeal level (1st, 2nd, 3rd)
3. Upload supporting documents:
   ‚Ä¢ Clinical notes
   ‚Ä¢ Lab results
   ‚Ä¢ Medical necessity letter
   ‚Ä¢ Peer-reviewed articles
4. Write appeal letter
5. Submit appeal
6. Track appeal status

**Payment Posting (EOB/ERA):**

When payment received:
1. System receives ERA (Electronic Remittance)
2. Or manually enter EOB (Explanation of Benefits)
3. Post payment:
   ‚Ä¢ Amount paid by insurance
   ‚Ä¢ Patient responsibility
   ‚Ä¢ Adjustments/contractual write-offs
   ‚Ä¢ Denial amounts
4. System updates:
   ‚Ä¢ Patient account balance
   ‚Ä¢ Claim status to 'Paid'
   ‚Ä¢ Generates patient statement if balance due

**Batch Claims Processing:**

1. Go to Claims > Batch Processing
2. Filter claims:
   ‚Ä¢ Date range
   ‚Ä¢ Payer
   ‚Ä¢ Provider
   ‚Ä¢ Status (Ready to Submit)
3. Select multiple claims
4. Bulk actions:
   ‚Ä¢ Submit all
   ‚Ä¢ Validate all
   ‚Ä¢ Export to file
   ‚Ä¢ Print batch

**Claims Reporting:**

**Available Reports:**
‚Ä¢ Claims Aging (by payer, provider)
‚Ä¢ Denial Rate Analysis
‚Ä¢ Days in A/R
‚Ä¢ Clean Claim Rate
‚Ä¢ Payment by Payer
‚Ä¢ Top Denial Reasons
‚Ä¢ Revenue by CPT Code

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Verify insurance before each visit
‚Ä¢ Submit claims within 24-48 hours
‚Ä¢ Review claims for accuracy before submission
‚Ä¢ Monitor aging reports weekly
‚Ä¢ Follow up on claims >30 days
‚Ä¢ Appeal valid denials promptly
‚Ä¢ Document all payer communications
‚Ä¢ Keep CPT and ICD-10 codes current
‚Ä¢ Train staff on coding updates
‚Ä¢ Use correct modifiers
‚Ä¢ Link appropriate diagnoses to procedures
‚Ä¢ Check timely filing limits by payer

articles.title: Offerings Management
articles.summary:
Manage healthcare service offerings and packages

Create service packages, set pricing, and manage what your practice offers to patients.
articles.content:
**Managing Healthcare Offerings:**

**What are Offerings?**
Offerings are healthcare services, packages, or programs your practice provides to patients. Examples:
‚Ä¢ Annual Wellness Package
‚Ä¢ Executive Physical
‚Ä¢ Weight Management Program
‚Ä¢ Chronic Care Management
‚Ä¢ Sports Physical
‚Ä¢ Travel Medicine Consultation
‚Ä¢ Concierge Medicine Membership

**Accessing Offerings:**
1. Go to Administration module
2. Click 'Healthcare Offerings'
3. View all active offerings
4. Click '+ New Offering' to create

**Creating New Offering:**

Step 1: Basic Information
‚Ä¢ Offering Name (e.g., "Annual Wellness Package")
‚Ä¢ Category:
  - Preventive Care
  - Chronic Disease Management
  - Specialty Services
  - Membership Programs
  - Wellness Programs
  - Diagnostic Services
‚Ä¢ Description (patient-facing, marketing copy)
‚Ä¢ Internal Notes (staff-only information)

Step 2: Services Included
Select what's included in offering:
‚Ä¢ Office visits (quantity and type)
‚Ä¢ Lab tests (specific tests)
‚Ä¢ Imaging studies
‚Ä¢ Procedures
‚Ä¢ Vaccinations
‚Ä¢ Counseling sessions
‚Ä¢ Follow-up calls/check-ins
‚Ä¢ Portal messaging access
‚Ä¢ After-hours availability

**Example - Annual Wellness Package:**
‚úì 1 Comprehensive Physical Exam (60 min)
‚úì Comprehensive Metabolic Panel (CMP)
‚úì Lipid Panel
‚úì HbA1c Test
‚úì Thyroid Panel (TSH, T4)
‚úì Urinalysis
‚úì EKG
‚úì Health Risk Assessment
‚úì Nutrition Counseling (30 min)
‚úì Personalized Wellness Plan
‚úì 1 Follow-up Visit (30 min)

Step 3: Pricing
‚Ä¢ Standard Price (full retail)
‚Ä¢ Member Price (if applicable)
‚Ä¢ Insurance Billable (yes/no)
‚Ä¢ Payment Options:
  - One-time payment
  - Monthly installments
  - Annual subscription
‚Ä¢ Tax Treatment (taxable/non-taxable)

Step 4: Eligibility & Requirements
‚Ä¢ Age Range (e.g., 18-64, 65+)
‚Ä¢ Gender (All, Male, Female)
‚Ä¢ Patient Type (New, Established, All)
‚Ä¢ Prerequisites (e.g., must complete health assessment)
‚Ä¢ Exclusions (contraindications)

Step 5: Scheduling
‚Ä¢ Can be scheduled online (yes/no)
‚Ä¢ Required appointment duration
‚Ä¢ Specific providers only (or all)
‚Ä¢ Specific locations (if multi-site)
‚Ä¢ Advance booking window (e.g., 7-90 days)

Step 6: Marketing & Display
‚Ä¢ Display on patient portal (yes/no)
‚Ä¢ Display on website (yes/no)
‚Ä¢ Featured offering (highlighted)
‚Ä¢ Upload images/brochure
‚Ä¢ SEO keywords
‚Ä¢ Call-to-action text

**Managing Existing Offerings:**

**Editing:**
1. Click offering from list
2. Click 'Edit'
3. Update any fields
4. Click 'Save Changes'
5. Changes effective immediately

**Activating/Deactivating:**
1. Toggle 'Active' switch
2. Active = Available for booking
3. Inactive = Hidden from patients, existing enrolled continue

**Archiving:**
1. Click 'Archive' on offering
2. Archived offerings not bookable
3. Existing enrollments handled per policy:
   ‚Ä¢ Complete existing
   ‚Ä¢ Refund prorated
   ‚Ä¢ Transfer to similar offering

**Patient Enrollment:**

**Enrolling Patients:**
1. Open patient chart
2. Go to 'Offerings' tab
3. Click '+ Enroll in Offering'
4. Select offering from dropdown
5. Choose payment plan
6. Set start date
7. Apply any discounts
8. Process payment or send invoice
9. Generate enrollment agreement
10. Patient signs consent

**Enrollment Status:**
‚Ä¢ Pending - Enrollment requested, awaiting payment
‚Ä¢ Active - Currently enrolled
‚Ä¢ Paused - Temporarily suspended
‚Ä¢ Completed - Offering period finished
‚Ä¢ Cancelled - Enrollment cancelled
‚Ä¢ Expired - Enrollment term ended

**Managing Enrollments:**

**Viewing Enrollments:**
1. Go to Healthcare Offerings
2. Click specific offering
3. View 'Enrollments' tab
4. See all patients enrolled
5. Filter by status, date, provider

**Tracking Usage:**
For each enrollment:
‚Ä¢ Services used vs. included
‚Ä¢ Appointments scheduled/completed
‚Ä¢ Tests ordered/completed
‚Ä¢ Next scheduled services
‚Ä¢ Remaining balance (visits, tests)
‚Ä¢ Renewal date

**Example Tracking:**
John Doe - Annual Wellness Package
‚úì Physical Exam (completed 1/1/2025)
‚úì CMP (completed 1/1/2025)
‚úì Lipid Panel (completed 1/1/2025)
‚è≥ Nutrition Counseling (scheduled 2/1/2025)
‚òê Follow-up Visit (not scheduled - 0/1 used)

**Renewal Management:**

**Auto-Renewal Settings:**
1. Edit offering
2. Enable 'Auto-renewal'
3. Set renewal terms:
   ‚Ä¢ 30 days before expiration
   ‚Ä¢ Automatic billing
   ‚Ä¢ Notification to patient
   ‚Ä¢ Opt-out window

**Manual Renewal:**
1. System notifies 60 days before expiration
2. Staff contacts patient
3. Update offering if changed
4. Process renewal payment
5. Extend enrollment period

**Reporting & Analytics:**

**Available Reports:**
‚Ä¢ Enrollment by Offering
‚Ä¢ Revenue by Offering
‚Ä¢ Most Popular Offerings
‚Ä¢ Completion Rates
‚Ä¢ Renewal Rates
‚Ä¢ Patient Demographics by Offering
‚Ä¢ Service Utilization
‚Ä¢ Average Revenue per Patient
‚Ä¢ Cancellation Reasons

**Marketing Integration:**

**Promoting Offerings:**
‚Ä¢ Email campaigns to patient list
‚Ä¢ Portal announcements
‚Ä¢ In-office signage/brochures
‚Ä¢ Website landing pages
‚Ä¢ Social media posts
‚Ä¢ Seasonal promotions

**Discount Codes:**
1. Create promo codes
2. Set discount amount/percentage
3. Set expiration date
4. Apply to specific offerings
5. Track redemptions

**Membership Programs:**

**Creating Memberships:**
Special type of offering with:
‚Ä¢ Monthly or annual fee
‚Ä¢ Ongoing benefits (not one-time)
‚Ä¢ Automatic renewal
‚Ä¢ Tiered levels (Basic, Premium, VIP)

**Example - Concierge Membership:**
Premium Level - $200/month:
‚Ä¢ Same/next-day appointments
‚Ä¢ Direct provider cell phone access
‚Ä¢ Extended 45-min appointments
‚Ä¢ No copays for visits
‚Ä¢ Annual physical included
‚Ä¢ 24/7 telehealth access
‚Ä¢ Prescription discounts
‚Ä¢ Quarterly wellness coaching

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Price competitively based on market research
‚Ä¢ Bundle complementary services
‚Ä¢ Clear descriptions of what's included
‚Ä¢ Update offerings based on patient feedback
‚Ä¢ Track utilization to optimize bundles
‚Ä¢ Promote preventive care packages
‚Ä¢ Offer payment plans for expensive packages
‚Ä¢ Set realistic appointment durations
‚Ä¢ Train staff on all offerings
‚Ä¢ Review and update quarterly
‚Ä¢ Use offerings for patient retention
‚Ä¢ Create seasonal offerings (flu season, sports physicals)
‚Ä¢ Ensure HIPAA compliance in marketing
‚Ä¢ Get legal review for membership agreements

articles.title: Campaigns Management
articles.summary:
Create and manage patient marketing campaigns

Send targeted email and SMS campaigns to specific patient segments for appointments, wellness, and engagement.
articles.content:
**Managing Marketing Campaigns:**

**What are Campaigns?**
Campaigns are targeted communications to specific patient groups via email, SMS, or portal. Common uses:
‚Ä¢ Appointment reminders
‚Ä¢ Wellness program promotion
‚Ä¢ Preventive care outreach (flu shots, annual physicals)
‚Ä¢ New service announcements
‚Ä¢ Patient education
‚Ä¢ Re-engagement of inactive patients
‚Ä¢ Birthday/holiday greetings
‚Ä¢ Patient satisfaction surveys

**Accessing Campaigns:**
1. Go to Marketing module
2. Click 'Campaigns'
3. View active, scheduled, and past campaigns
4. Click '+ New Campaign' to create

**Creating New Campaign:**

Step 1: Campaign Basics
‚Ä¢ Campaign Name (internal, e.g., "2025 Flu Shot Outreach")
‚Ä¢ Campaign Type:
  - Appointment Reminder
  - Wellness Promotion
  - Re-engagement
  - Educational
  - Promotional
  - Survey/Feedback
‚Ä¢ Description/Goal
‚Ä¢ Start and End Dates

Step 2: Target Audience

**Patient Segmentation:**
Create filters to target specific patients:

**Demographics:**
‚Ä¢ Age range (e.g., 65+ for Medicare wellness)
‚Ä¢ Gender
‚Ä¢ Location/zip code
‚Ä¢ Language preference

**Clinical:**
‚Ä¢ Specific diagnoses (e.g., diabetics for A1C reminder)
‚Ä¢ Medications (e.g., warfarin patients for INR)
‚Ä¢ Last visit date (e.g., >12 months for re-engagement)
‚Ä¢ Overdue preventive care
‚Ä¢ Lab results in range

**Behavioral:**
‚Ä¢ Portal users vs. non-users
‚Ä¢ Appointment no-show history
‚Ä¢ Payment history
‚Ä¢ Enrollment in programs/offerings

**Example Segments:**

**Flu Shot Campaign:**
‚Ä¢ Age 50+ OR high-risk conditions
‚Ä¢ No flu vaccine current season
‚Ä¢ Active patients (visit in last 24 months)

**Diabetic A1C Reminder:**
‚Ä¢ Diagnosis: Diabetes (ICD E11.9)
‚Ä¢ Last A1C >90 days ago
‚Ä¢ Active patients

**Re-engagement:**
‚Ä¢ No visit in 18+ months
‚Ä¢ Previously active (3+ visits historically)
‚Ä¢ Age 18-75
‚Ä¢ Not deceased or moved

Step 3: Message Creation

**Channel Selection:**
‚òëÔ∏è Email
‚òëÔ∏è SMS/Text
‚òëÔ∏è Portal Message
‚òê Phone Call (manual)
‚òê Postcard (mail)

**Email Message:**
1. Subject Line (compelling, clear)
2. Preview Text (appears in inbox)
3. Email Body:
   ‚Ä¢ Use template or create custom
   ‚Ä¢ Rich text editor with formatting
   ‚Ä¢ Insert merge fields (patient name, provider)
   ‚Ä¢ Add images/logos
   ‚Ä¢ Include call-to-action button
   ‚Ä¢ Add unsubscribe link (required)
4. Mobile-responsive design

**SMS Message:**
1. Limited to 160 characters
2. Clear, concise message
3. Include opt-out instructions (STOP)
4. Insert merge fields
5. Optional link (use URL shortener)

**Merge Fields:**
Personalize messages:
‚Ä¢ {{FirstName}}
‚Ä¢ {{LastName}}
‚Ä¢ {{PreferredName}}
‚Ä¢ {{ProviderName}}
‚Ä¢ {{ClinicName}}
‚Ä¢ {{NextAppointment}}
‚Ä¢ {{LastVisitDate}}

**Example Messages:**

**Email - Flu Shot:**
Subject: Protect Yourself This Flu Season, {{FirstName}}!

Hi {{FirstName}},

Flu season is here! Protect yourself and your loved ones with a flu vaccine.

‚úì Quick and convenient
‚úì No appointment needed
‚úì Walk-ins welcome Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
‚úì Most insurance covers 100%

[Schedule Your Flu Shot]

Questions? Call us at (555) 123-4567.

Stay healthy,
{{ClinicName}} Team

**SMS - Appointment Reminder:**
"Hi {{FirstName}}! Reminder: You have an appt with Dr. {{ProviderName}} tomorrow at {{AppointmentTime}}. Reply C to confirm or R to reschedule. Reply STOP to opt out."

Step 4: Scheduling

**Send Options:**
‚Ä¢ Send Now - Immediate delivery
‚Ä¢ Schedule - Specific date/time
‚Ä¢ Recurring - Repeat campaign
‚Ä¢ Drip Campaign - Sequence over time

**Best Send Times:**
‚Ä¢ Email: Tuesday-Thursday 10am-2pm
‚Ä¢ SMS: 10am-6pm (avoid early morning/late evening)
‚Ä¢ Avoid Mondays and Fridays
‚Ä¢ Consider time zones

**Frequency Limits:**
Set rules to prevent over-messaging:
‚Ä¢ Max 1 promotional email per week
‚Ä¢ Max 2 SMS per month
‚Ä¢ Exclude patients who opted out
‚Ä¢ Respect quiet hours (9pm-9am)

Step 5: Compliance & Consent

**HIPAA Compliance:**
‚Ä¢ Only use secure, encrypted channels
‚Ä¢ Don't include PHI in subject lines
‚Ä¢ Limit clinical details in messages
‚Ä¢ Audit trail for all communications
‚Ä¢ Patient consent documented

**Consent Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Email: Implied for existing patients
‚Ä¢ SMS: Explicit opt-in required
‚Ä¢ Marketing: Can opt-out anytime
‚Ä¢ Appointment reminders: Different rules (operational)

**Opt-Out Management:**
‚Ä¢ Automatic opt-out processing
‚Ä¢ "Reply STOP" for SMS
‚Ä¢ Unsubscribe link for email
‚Ä¢ Remove from future campaigns
‚Ä¢ Document opt-out date

Step 6: Review and Launch

**Pre-Launch Checklist:**
‚úì Target audience count reasonable
‚úì Message proofread (no typos)
‚úì Merge fields tested
‚úì Links work correctly
‚úì Mobile preview checked
‚úì Unsubscribe link present
‚úì Compliance verified
‚úì Approval obtained (if required)

**Test Campaign:**
1. Send to test group (staff emails)
2. Verify formatting
3. Check links
4. Test on mobile devices
5. Confirm deliverability

**Launch:**
1. Final review
2. Click 'Launch Campaign'
3. System begins sending
4. Monitor real-time progress

**Monitoring Campaign Performance:**

**Real-Time Metrics:**
‚Ä¢ Total sent
‚Ä¢ Delivery rate
‚Ä¢ Open rate (email)
‚Ä¢ Click-through rate
‚Ä¢ Bounce rate
‚Ä¢ Unsubscribe rate
‚Ä¢ Conversion rate (appointments booked)

**Email Metrics:**
‚Ä¢ Sent: 1,000
‚Ä¢ Delivered: 980 (98%)
‚Ä¢ Opened: 392 (40%)
‚Ä¢ Clicked: 98 (10%)
‚Ä¢ Bounced: 20 (2%)
‚Ä¢ Unsubscribed: 5 (0.5%)
‚Ä¢ Appointments Booked: 45 (4.6% conversion)

**SMS Metrics:**
‚Ä¢ Sent: 500
‚Ä¢ Delivered: 495 (99%)
‚Ä¢ Clicked: 125 (25%)
‚Ä¢ Opt-outs: 2 (0.4%)
‚Ä¢ Responses: 87 (17.4%)

**Post-Campaign Analysis:**

**Available Reports:**
‚Ä¢ Campaign Performance Summary
‚Ä¢ Audience Engagement by Segment
‚Ä¢ ROI Analysis (cost vs. revenue generated)
‚Ä¢ Bounce Analysis (update contact info)
‚Ä¢ A/B Test Results
‚Ä¢ Time-of-Day Performance
‚Ä¢ Device Breakdown (mobile vs. desktop)

**Drip Campaigns:**

**What are Drip Campaigns?**
Automated series of messages over time.

**Example - New Patient Onboarding:**
‚Ä¢ Day 1: Welcome email with portal setup
‚Ä¢ Day 3: SMS reminder to complete health history
‚Ä¢ Day 7: Email about services and offerings
‚Ä¢ Day 14: Survey about first visit experience
‚Ä¢ Day 30: Email about preventive care schedule

**Example - Chronic Care Management:**
‚Ä¢ Week 1: Educational content about condition
‚Ä¢ Week 2: Medication adherence tips
‚Ä¢ Week 3: Lifestyle modification resources
‚Ä¢ Week 4: Schedule follow-up appointment
‚Ä¢ Repeat monthly with new content

**A/B Testing:**

**Testing Variables:**
‚Ä¢ Subject lines
‚Ä¢ Send times
‚Ä¢ Message length
‚Ä¢ Call-to-action wording
‚Ä¢ Images vs. text-only
‚Ä¢ Sender name

**How to A/B Test:**
1. Create two versions (A and B)
2. Split audience 50/50
3. Send simultaneously
4. Compare performance
5. Use winner for future campaigns

**Campaign Templates:**

**Pre-Built Templates:**
‚Ä¢ Annual Physical Reminder
‚Ä¢ Flu Shot Promotion
‚Ä¢ Appointment Reminder
‚Ä¢ Birthday Wishes
‚Ä¢ Patient Satisfaction Survey
‚Ä¢ New Service Announcement
‚Ä¢ Insurance Information Update
‚Ä¢ Portal Registration Invitation

**Creating Custom Templates:**
1. Design message
2. Add merge fields
3. Save as template
4. Reuse for future campaigns
5. Update as needed

**Budget & Cost Tracking:**

**Campaign Costs:**
‚Ä¢ SMS: ~$0.01-0.03 per message
‚Ä¢ Email: ~$0.001 per email (or unlimited)
‚Ä¢ Design/copywriting time
‚Ä¢ Tool/platform fees

**ROI Calculation:**
‚Ä¢ Revenue generated (appointments booked)
‚Ä¢ Minus campaign costs
‚Ä¢ Equals ROI

**Example:**
Flu Shot Campaign:
‚Ä¢ Cost: $50 (500 SMS √ó $0.10)
‚Ä¢ Appointments booked: 75
‚Ä¢ Revenue: $1,875 (75 √ó $25)
‚Ä¢ ROI: 3,650%

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Segment audiences for relevance
‚Ä¢ Personalize messages with merge fields
‚Ä¢ Clear call-to-action in every message
‚Ä¢ Mobile-first design
‚Ä¢ Test before launching
‚Ä¢ Monitor deliverability rates
‚Ä¢ Clean contact lists regularly
‚Ä¢ Respect frequency limits
‚Ä¢ Always include opt-out
‚Ä¢ Track ROI on every campaign
‚Ä¢ Use templates for consistency
‚Ä¢ A/B test to optimize
‚Ä¢ Comply with HIPAA and TCPA
‚Ä¢ Get consent for SMS
‚Ä¢ Schedule at optimal times
‚Ä¢ Follow up on engagement
‚Ä¢ Update based on performance data
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with front desk on responses
